page.title: 06PROBLEMS : LACK OF INDUSTRY
page.content: In the 1970s plans were advanced for some{light industry}being developed in Kirkby Lonsdale but the siting in an area of such beauty proved to be an insurmountable problem.The{lack of {industrial development}has serious implications for the locality as the {employment prospects}for many young people in the immediate vicinity are poor,unless they are able to work on a farm or in one of the many small family businesses.It also means that commuting by car has become a regular way of life for some,and Kirkby has in some respects become a{dormitory town, serving large centres,such as Kendal and Lancaster.Young people who move away are completely lost to the community and unless those who travel outside to work can be involved in their town,then the{traditional}idea of a community begins to break down.
